text: for Prime Minister thank you if you
really believe as you speak suggest that
we would be more likely to see war on
our continent if we vote to leave the EU
why on earth did you offer of this
referendum in the first place isn't this
warning at best alarmist and at worst a
bit desperate especially given it until
three months ago you said you would be
willing to lead us out of the Union I
think it's right to have the referendum
because you shouldn't try and hold a
independent and sovereign nation in an
organization against its will and this
is a great act of sovereignty the
British people after 40 years of
membership of this organization are
being given the opportunity to say again
staying in or shall we go out and I
think that's right we're a democracy we
do things voluntarily but I've always
believed that we're better off inside a
reformed European Union indeed during
those negotiations I was often
criticized for not saying tell us you'll
walk away i always said the best answer
for britain is to get the reforms we
need and to vote to stay in but many of
the reasons that I've given today but we
have 45 days to go it's a huge decision
I want to say how calmly clearly in a
very frank manner what I've learned over
the last six years and what I think the
country it should do and that's what
today is about what I'm saying is simply
this the EU is one of the institutions
one of the organizations that has helped
bring peace to our continent NATO's play
a very clear role the relationship
between different countries has played a
very clear role but there's no doubt in
my mind the European Union has helped
bring former adversaries together can we
know what would happen if we were to
leave and if
were to change back back to what it was
we can't now but is it a risk worth
taking and I would argue when we've got
the best of both worlds when we're in
the single market but out of the euro
when we can work and travel freely but
we keep our borders when you've got the
best of both worlds then go for the
strength in numbers that membership of
the European Union and membership of
NATO give us and in the end as Prime
Minister that's your responsibility is
to speak very frankly to the British
people about how we strengthen our
economy how we safeguard our people and
how we ensure a strong Brittany in the
world that's what this is all about
